Interface Matrix2

All Known Implementing Classes:
Matrix2f
public interface Matrix2
This interface defines the operations for a square 2x2 matrix.

Implementations are meant to use a column-major layout. This is the standard convention followed by mathematical texts and OpenGL/GLSL.

This interface implies this convention by the overloaded #mult(Vector2) method expecting a vector, where the vector being multiplied is on the right side of the matrix. In other words, a matrix M and a vector v must be multiplied as v' = Mv to produce a new column-vector v' as the output.

Author:
Raymond L. Rivera

  • Method Details

    • value

      float value(int row, int col)
      Returns the scalar value at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
      col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
      Returns:
      The scalar value found at the specified location.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either index is outside the [0, 1] range.

    • row

      Vector2 row(int row)
      Returns the specified matrix row as a vector.
      Parameters:
      row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
      Returns:
      A vector with data from the specified row.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the row index is outside the [0, 1] range.

    • column

      Vector2 column(int col)
      Returns the specified matrix column as a vector.
      Parameters:
      col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
      Returns:
      A vector with data from the specified column.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the column index is outside the [0, 1] range.

    • add

      Matrix2 add(Matrix2 m)
      Add the specified matrix to this matrix.
      Parameters:
      m - The matrix that will be added to this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this addition.

    • sub

      Matrix2 sub(Matrix2 m)
      Subtract the specified matrix from this matrix.
      Parameters:
      m - The matrix that will be subtracted from this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this subtraction.

    • mult

      Matrix2 mult(float scalar)
      Multiply this matrix by the specified scalar value.
      Parameters:
      scalar - The scalar value by which this matrix will be multiplied or scaled.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this multiplication.

    • mult

      Vector2 mult(Vector2 v)
      Multiply this matrix by the specified column vector.
      Parameters:
      v - The vector by which this matrix will be multiplied or scaled.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this multiplication.

    • mult

      Matrix2 mult(Matrix2 m)
      Multiply this matrix by the specified matrix. Also known as concatenation.
      Parameters:
      m - The matrix that will be multiplied by, or concatenated to, this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the result of this multiplication.

    • rotate

      Matrix2 rotate(Angle angle)
      Rotate this matrix by the specified angle.
      Parameters:
      angle - The angle of rotation to be applied.
      Returns:
      A new matrix with the specified rotation applied.

    • scale

      Matrix2 scale(float sx, float sy)
      Scale this matrix by the specified scalar values.
      Parameters:
      sx - A value used to scale the x component in the first column.
      sy - A value used to scale the y component in the second column.
      Returns:
      A new matrix scaled by the specified values.

    • scale

      Matrix2 scale(Vector2 v)
      Scale this matrix by the specified column vector.
      Parameters:
      v - A vector used to scale this matrix.
      Returns:
      A new matrix scaled by the specified column vector.

    • determinant

      float determinant()
      Returns the determinant of this matrix.

      Note that if the determinant is zero, then this matrix is singular and cannot be inverted.

      Returns:
      The determinant of this matrix.

    • inverse

      Matrix2 inverse()
      Returns a new matrix that is the inverse of this matrix, if possible.

      If this matrix is a singular matrix, then it's not possible to calculate its inverse.

      Returns:
      The inverse of this matrix.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If this is a non-invertible matrix.

    • transpose

      Matrix2 transpose()
      Returns a new matrix that is the transpose of this matrix.

      Transposing a matrix means swapping the columns with the rows.

      Returns:
      The transpose of this matrix.

    • toFloatArray

      float[] toFloatArray()
      Returns an array with a copy of the object's internal values.
      Returns:
      A copy of the object's internal values as an array.
